qas.question: What were the countries who supported the US's post-9/11 invasions called?
How many soldiers did Pakistan contribute to fight the Taliban?
Where did Pakistan try to remove the Taliban and Al-Qaeda?

plausible_answers.text: America made clear its determination to invade Iraq

qas.question: What action made support for the US increase?
Which country refused to send troops into Afghanistan?
How many soldiers did the coalition of the willing contribute?

plausible_answers.text: remove the Taliban insurgency and al-Qaeda element

qas.question: What was Afghanistan attempting with the US's help?

context: Support for the U.S. cooled when <b5_0>America made clear its determination to invade Iraq<b5_0/> in late 2002. Even so, many of <a0_0>the "coalition of the willing"<a0_0/> countries that unconditionally supported the U.S.-led military action have sent troops to Afghanistan, particular neighboring <a1_0><b6_0>Pakistan<b6_0/><a1_0/>, which has disowned its earlier support for the Taliban and contributed <a2_0><b7_0>tens of thousands<b7_0/><a2_0/> of soldiers to the conflict. Pakistan was also engaged in the War in <a3_0>North-West<a3_0/> Pakistan (<b8_0>Waziristan War<b8_0/>). Supported by U.S. intelligence, Pakistan was attempting to <b9_0>remove the Taliban insurgency and al-Qaeda element<b9_0/> from the <a4_0>northern tribal areas<a4_0/>.
